message: Este es el primer post del blog de Mexican.VC. Es una breve pieza colaborativa entre Santiago, David, Lisa y yo. Esperamos su retroalimentación: http://blog.mexican.vc/if-you-want-to-build-something-great-it-shoul
Por cierto, si nos quieren regalar un upvote en HN, ahora es cuando: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2443792
Estoy viendo que nuestro tio PG respondio al post. Bueno, le acabo de dar un reply a ver que les parece.
y tu respuesta estuvo muy buena!
Gracias, la verdad es que es un momento interesante cuando te das cuenta que pg sabe de tu proyecto.
Wtf, hasta ahora estoy leyendo HN. Mr PG himfockinself respondiendo! Muy bueno.

Yo tengo muchas problemas aqui en mexico para tienar mi empresa mexicana, porque soy uno extranjero. Muchos gentes con moral malo y mucho problemas burocratico. Si eres extranjero, tu necesita saber, que en mucho paises, es no facil crear una empresa. Pero soy fuerte y superar todos estos pequenos detalles anyway :D
@dsch What you say about how difficult is to create a company in Mexico in part explains why we don't have as much startups as we would like. We need to create a better ecosystem.
I bet is convenience as some of the co-founders don't speak Spanish :p
Ah si, por que es Mexican.VC en ingles? Yo gusto porque mi espanol es no bueno, pero me pregunta por que... :)
@dsch I think it's a filter. Understanding english is an important prerequisite to be a global entrepreneur.

@willygru seams to make most sense :D Also, mexico just have a really bad name in the world, many friends think I am crazy to move to Mexico because of the violence, but it is only what the media tells (I have lived in Israel as well, which have the same image, also here in mexico). I do not think it is more difficult than europe, it is just an old system (I probably put my girlfriend as owner, if it keeps being problems with me being a foreigner, this is how it is done in my country, which is much more hard on foreigners) and unfortunately I have experienced many mexican people who are only interested in getting as much money out of foreigners as possible, without care of how the present their own country and people. But well, I am pretty tough so I manage :)
@dsch I understand, but it's not pleasant to hear that you're having trouble setting up your business here. And you're not crazy, there still are plenty of good people! :)
